abstract: Extreme Programming (XP) is an agile software development methodology composed of several practices that purportedly yield high quality and high customer satisfaction. However, there has been little formal investigation of these claims. We conduct empirical, industrial case studies to evaluate XP. Results from two case studies are presented.

authors.name: Lucas Layman
authors.affiliation: North Carolina State University, Raleigh, NC

title: Empirical investigation of the impact of extreme programming practices on software projects
